comment: This is a page from a classical Chinese dictionary or lexicon, likely a version of the *Shuowen Jiezi* (说文解字) or similar work, showing characters related to the radical '山' (mountain). Each entry includes the character in seal script (篆书), its definition, phonetic notation (using *fanqie* method), and etymological components. The layout is traditional vertical columns from right to left. The side margin contains pagination and possibly publisher or edition information ('大三十二', '兑文乙下', '二', '陳廣').
